alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 8:50PM CST until March 04 at 7:02PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Portions of Highway 28 effected. Timber and pasture along West Bank floods. Property and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Thursday the stage was 3.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 24.4 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Gravelly 24.0 3.8 Thu 7 PM 22.1 7.9 6.5 24.4 12 PM 3/03 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
